messages.content: You are tasked with creating a structured output from the provided user message.

Full path
- /v1/comments/{comment}

All methods allowed?
- No

Methods:
- HEAD: No
- POST: No
- OPTIONS: No
- TRACE: No
- GET: No
- PUT: No
- DELETE: Yes
- PATCH: No

Explanation
- In routes/api.php there is a Route::prefix('v1')->group(...). Inside the authenticated middleware group the file registers Route::apiResource('comments', CommentController::class)->only('destroy');. The apiResource destroy action corresponds to a DELETE route for the resource item, i.e. DELETE /comments/{comment}, and the prefix('v1') makes the full path /v1/comments/{comment}.
- No route definition in the provided files registers any other HTTP method (GET/POST/PUT/PATCH/HEAD/OPTIONS/TRACE) for this endpoint, so only DELETE is acceptable based on the code. The "all methods" override is not present.
- The determination is strictly from the route definitions in the code (and the mapping of resource action "destroy" to DELETE /resource/{resource}); no runtime/framework assumptions (such as implicit HEAD/OPTIONS handling) were used.
